question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_streaming_response()] [Error Propagation Loss] Multiple break statements at lines 366, 378, 411, 442, 474 exit the loop and return Ok(()) at line 504 - can critical errors be suppressed as successful completions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_streaming_response()] [Task Error Aggregation] Line 419-422 checks if any task failed with complex nested Result checking - can task panics vs task errors be distinguished properly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_transactions_from_node_response()] [Error Metric Granularity] Line 269 uses generic 'failed_to_update_cache_version' label - can different error types be distinguished for proper alerting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_streaming_response()] [Memory Exhaustion via Large Batches] If num_of_transactions in BatchEnd is extremely large (billions), can the version arithmetic or memory for tracking this cause DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_transactions_from_node_response()] [CPU Exhaustion via Compression] If cache_storage_format is Lz4CompressedProto, can specially crafted transaction data cause compression bombs or excessive CPU usage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_streaming_response()] [File Store Wait Loop DoS] If file store stops progressing, the infinite loop at line 479 continues checking forever - can this be exploited to hang the cache worker indefinitely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: Worker::run()] [Metadata Wait DoS] The while loop at line 124 waits for file store metadata indefinitely - can attacker delaying metadata creation prevent cache worker startup permanently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_transactions_from_node_response()] [Transaction List Validation] Besides checking for empty lists at lines 214-222, are transaction versions within the list validated for continuity and ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_streaming_response()] [Chain ID Consistency] Chain ID is checked at line 382 during streaming - but only with panic! Can chain ID change mid-stream due to network issues or attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: verify_fullnode_init_signal()] [Starting Version Bounds] Is there validation that starting_version is within reasonable bounds (not 0 or near u64::MAX), or can extreme values cause issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_streaming_response()] [Size Validation] The size_in_bytes from encoded_len() is logged but not validated - can extremely large messages cause memory issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: Worker::run()] [GRPC Client Security] The create_grpc_client() call at line 117 doesn't specify TLS or authentication - can man-in-the-middle attacks inject malicious transaction streams? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: Worker::run()] [Request Parameter Injection] GetTransactionsFromNodeRequest at lines 148-151 uses Default::default() for unspecified fields - can missing parameter validation on server side cause unexpected behavior? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: process_streaming_response()] [Protobuf Deserialization] TransactionsFromNodeResponse is deserialized from the stream - are there protobuf parsing vulnerabilities that could be exploited with malformed messages? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/worker.rs] [Function: Worker::run()] [Three-Way Version Sync] Starting version must match between file_store_metadata (line 139), fullnode init signal (line 299), and cache (line 311) - can race conditions cause sync failures?
